datafield.subfield: 180 x 130 (113 x 60) mm bound to 180 x 135 mm.
Shelfmark: Ann Arbor, University of Michigan, Special Collections Library, Isl. Ms. 1
Origin: Lacks dated colophon ; paper would suggest 18th century. Dated seal impressions provide only approximate terminus ante quem but also may suggest 18th century.
Former shelfmark: British Museum, London "No. 103. Kuran."

Binding: Pasteboards covered in red-brown leather ; Type II binding (with flap) ; board linings, doublure hinges, and lining of envelope flap in shell marbled paper (pink and brown) ; fine printed fabric in yellow, blue and pink lining fore-edge flap ; upper and lower covers bear blind-tooled arrangement of rosette-shaped stamps forming a central diamond-shaped ornament and accents along with border in s-shaped stamps ; sewn in cream thread, two stations ; endbands virtually gone, only traces of primaries remain ; in poor condition with much abrasion, staining, some delaminating of boards, fore-edge flap detaching from lower cover, lower cover detaching at spine, a few loose quires, etc.

Support: European laid paper with 13 laid lines per cm. (horizontal) and chain lines (vertical) spaced 26 mm. apart ; watermarks include an eagle and scrollwork with lion rampant (compare Heawood 1262) ; fairly well-burnished and smooth.

Decoration: Richly decorated polychrome double-page opening with scalloped dome headpieces in green and red filled with swirling vegetal pattern and surmounted by vertical stalks (tīgh) accompanied by rectangular panels carrying the opening text (al-Fātiḥah facing opening of Sūrat al-Baqarah), headings and the āyah "انه لقرآن كريم في كتاب مكنون لا يمسه الا المطهرون وينزل من رب العالمين" ; entire piece is bordered by a frame in red and green with rule-border at some distance in the margin ; verse dividers in the form of stylized red circles appear throughout ; rule-border surrounds written area throughout ; text rubricated with sūrah headings, juzʼ markers, etc. in red.
Script: Naskh ; elegant Ottoman hand ; partially seriffed with occasional right-sloping head-serifs on most vertical shafts in the majority of the text ; effect of tilt to the left ; fully vocalized.
Layout: Written in 15 lines per page ; frame-ruled (impression of ruling board evident).

Collation: i, VI+1 (13), V+1 (24), 9 VI(132), VII (146), 6 VI(218), V (228), 9 VI(336), II (340) ; chiefly sexternions ; final leaf left blank ; catchwords present ; pagination in pencil, Western numerals, supplied during digitization (includes front flyleaf).
Neat copy of the Qurʼān with a few former owners' marks.
Acquired by purchase along with Abdul Hamid Collection (funds donated by Horace Rackham).

Bookplate of British Museum, London on inner front cover,"British Museum, London. No. 103. Kuran." ; circular seal impression with figure of goat/gazelle in purple ink as well as inscription "295" in Western numerals on front flyleaf (p.1) ; childish scribbles on front flyleaf and elsewhere ; a few circular seal impressions on fol.340a (p.681), one containing "عبد الله ..." possibly dated 1271 [1854 or 5], along with octagonal seal impression possibly dated 1120 [1708 or 9], "عبد الله بنده خدا ۱۱۲۰[؟]" within and inscription "عبد الله" below ; a few marginal corrections ; notabilia marking each جزء and occasionally نصف جزء and حزب appear in red ink, black ink, or even pencil ; idiosyncratic numeral thalāthah is used (see sidehead for الجزء الثالث عشر on fol.138b/p.278).
